source.name: Fixed Length Records
source.instructions:
For this challenge, you are being passed a `filepath` and for each row in the 2D `data` array:
- A first name
- A last name
- A birthday in DDMMYYYY order

Write to the file so that the resulting content should look like this:

`Name........Lastname....DDMMYYYY`
`Name........Lastname....DDMMYYYY`
`Name........Lastname....DDMMYYYY`

Where each column, except for the last one, is being separated by `.` characters that are the result of subtracting the column length minus a fixed record length of 12.

source.name: Account Transactions
source.instructions:
Given pipe-delimited files `F1` and `F2` where `F1` contains accounts with fields `ACCOUNT NUM|PIN|BALANCE` and `F2` contains transaction instructions `COMMAND|AMOUNT|ACCOUNT NUM|PIN`, execute the transactions, storing the results back in `F1`. 

The `COMMAND` field will be `add` or `sub` indicating addition or subtraction from the account.

Transactions which do not provide the correct `PIN` code or attempt to put the account below zero should be ignored.

source.name: Variable Length Records
source.instructions:
Load the pipe-delimited file `P`. It is organized with 3 fields on each line: `firstname|lastname|birthday`.

Search for the firstname `F` and lastname `L`, replacing the birthday with `B`. Write the `O` file back out in the same pipe-delimited format.
You will be passed a file path `P` on the command line. Output the content of file P.
source.name: Read a Text File

source.instructions:
You will be provided a file path for input `I`, a file path for output `O`, a string `S`, and a string `T`.

Read the contents of `I`, replacing each occurrence of `S` with `T` and write the resulting information to file `O`. 

You should replace `O` if it already exists.
source.name: Writing a Text File
